AnsweredQuestion.Name: Try Area rather than Height
AnsweredQuestion.Description: Height is better than Area in separating the data points.

AnsweredQuestion.Name: Use 2010's call to color data points
AnsweredQuestion.Description: it looks like 2010 has some errors, like snpid=34. the few heterozygous calls in 2010 are undisputably homozygous in cluster plots. also some homozygous calls in 2010 fall into the other allele's cloud in cluster plots.

DEFAULT.Name: Summary
DEFAULT.Description: a difference matrix by all data

AnsweredQuestion.Name: inconsistent results
AnsweredQuestion.Description:
Two programs (CmpAccession2Ecotype.py, Cmp149SNPVs2010.py) doing the same thing as computing the difference matrix give different outcomes.
Cmp149SNPVs2010.py maps a lot more heterozygous calls in sequenom to NA in 2010 than CmpAccession2Ecotype.py. It turned out those NAs are not touched (no fragment sequenced) in 2010. The results are actually same.

DEFAULT.Name: QC
DEFAULT.Description: 1st strain selecting, 2nd throw away bad SNP columns, 3rd is merging same strain data

AnsweredQuestion.Name: cross match 2010's Will(acc=384) to 149SNP's Wil-1 (8419) and 250k's Wil-1(8419)
AnsweredQuestion.Description:
2010 doesn't have Wil-1.
149SNP has Will=8250 but no genotyping data.
a comparison between 2010's Will(acc=384) and 149SNP's Wil-1 (8419) has 1/3 mismatch rate, unreliable!
so has to do the comparison between 250k's Wil-1 (8419) and 2010's Will (acc=384)
250k's Wil-1 (ecotype_id=8419, array_id=34 or 292), simple calling algorithm (call_info_id=91 or 455). For array_id=34, mismatch_rate=1/37. For array_id=292, mismatch_rate=11/43.

DEFAULT.Name: identify contaminant by criteria

if QC against 2010, 149, 384 shows significant difference, contaminated
if belonging to a haplotype group far away from its origin, contaminated

DEFAULT.Name: Top SNP test
DEFAULT.Description: Hypergenomic test or chi-squared test

DEFAULT.Name: Venn diagram showing overlapping of top SNP-genes
pvalue cutoff depends on MAF
DEFAULT.Description:
2008-09-01
apparently, methods have different power at different MAF. Zhang2007a, Marchini2005, even our own data can demonstrate that. however, the peak is always around 0.1. It then tapers off till 0.5.
This might mean causal SNPs with frequency 0.1-0.5 might just get lower pvalues or score due to methodoligcal limitation.
According to Wang2005a, MAF<0.1 would require unrealistic sample size and big effect size, so for MAF (0.1, 0.5), take 0.05 window size and take the top SNPs in each MAF window.
